reviews.text: Discover France booked our group of 12 women into the Maison Rouge for 3 nights, before and after our walking trip in Alsace. I had read that the rooms could be hot, but was pleased to find quiet and efficient air conditioning. The rooms are small, like all 3 star French hotels, but elegant and immaculate, with pristine granite and white tile bathrooms. I had a balcony overlooking the street (and the spiffy trams which rolled by every few minutes), but thanks to the roll-down shutters and double glass doors, it was vey quiet at night.
reviews.title: Great location, rooms, service

likes.disliked: — small for two unrelated adults travelling togethe

reviews.title: very nice hotel in old town center right on the tram line
reviews.text: Breakfasts (included in our tariff) were substantial, and the service at the front desk superb. A group of 12 always has a few special demands, and the hotel staff were gracious about fulfilling them. I would highly recommend this hotel, which is located within walking distance of Strasbourg's many attractions.

Our original hotel did not honor our supposedly confirmed reservations, so their concierge found us a room at the Maison Rouge. We had a very pleasant unplanned stay at the Maison Rouge . Clean, comfortable rooms. Very help front desk staff. Good European style breakfast (included in weekend rates only). Our next trip to Strasbourg will find us at Maison Rouge.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

likes.disliked: — noisy train right outside our room

reviews.title: Nice hotel but beware in summer--no air conditioning
reviews.text: Stayed over New Years. "Perfect location", but very difficult to find despite a GPS. The breakfast was NOT included...felt a bit stung..although it was very good. Also did not ask about reserved hotel parking...had to drive in circles to find the parking underground lot. Learned the lesson to ASK about everything!

When we first arrived at the hotel we were very pleased with its appearance and location. It was hot as it usually is in July and we were given a room on the top floor that was incredibly hot and had no air circulation. After pleading, we were moved to the fourth floor, better but still not air conditioned. Most of the hallways are air conditioned, so why does a three and a half star hotel still have limited rooms with air conditioning? We were not the only guests complaining. I would stay here again only not in the summer or if I were garanteed an air conditoned room. Avoid a room on the sixth floor unless you're not clostrophobic or if you got the room for a real bargain.
reviews.title: Great locations, STINKY smell !!

reviews.text: Great staff. Very good, central location. Next to one of the large department stores, Galleries Lafayette. The grocery department of the store is a few steps from the hotel. Reasonably quite, almost no car traffic, just electric streetcar rumble.
reviews.title: très bon

reviews.text: Hotel staff was very good, English friendly. Room was clean, fairly large, comfortable (firm) bed. Bath had a bidet. Room had a tiny, but nice, balcony.
reviews.title: Perfect, central location

reviews.text: TV was small CRT type. English channels - BBC world, CNN, & CNBC. Also a few German channels.
reviews.title: Very central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wifi available for fee thru the France telecom Orange networks. Didn't use, only one reception bar, sometimes none, in my room. Several wifi plans, example: 10 euros for 3 hours use over 30 days. Hardly any open wifi available around town. I found only one open wifi spot, near a Timberland store.
reviews.title: Central Location Was Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet 14 euros.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Maison Rouge Hotel is located in the center of Strasbourg, and is a convenient base for touring the city on foot. It is easy to find, but parking is in a public garage a couple of blocks away, so print the hotel directions to it before arriving. There is a Maison Rouge shopping mall a half block away that is not connected to the hotel, avoid any confusion.
reviews.title: Classical ambience in the city center

reviews.text: The hotel has a classical feel; each floor has a public sitting area with overhead ceiling painting, for example. But the overall effect is very friendly and warm. The front desk staff is very friendly and knowledgable: they gave us a map and directions to nearby attractions and restaurants (The cathedral is amazing, and the tourist office is also there). There are elevators to the upstairs rooms, and a nice lobby sitting area.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The room felt a bit small and dark; it had shutters to limit the temparature rise from daytime sun. The bed was comfortable and the working area was adequate: there was not internet access. There was a minibar and cable TV, and the bathroom was well appointed and had a good tub / shower combination.
reviews.title: Comfort in the heart of Strasbourg

reviews.text: The breakfast was expensive, but there are lots of cafe's and coffee shops nearby. The 'Petite France' area is wonderful for dinner and strolling, and good Alsace food is avaiable everywhere.
reviews.title: Prime location, great 80's feeling, very clean

likes.liked: — very clean and well kept, great 80's style,

reviews.text: This is a comfortable and warm travelers hotel that makes a good base for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient, friendly

likes.disliked: — In room amenities could be better

reviews.text: we booked six rooms trough france-hotels.com in January for May, this service is linked with official strasburg tourist-web-site, they confirmed and charged my card for deposit. At the hotel they hadn't received a reservation,but were helpful and after two hours of waiting we got our six , nice ,clean and well maintained rooms(even on one floor, door to door!) At checkout they tried to charge rack-rate without deduction of deposit, after reminder they charged at least the rate i had booked for.
reviews.title: good location, nice rooms, make sure , that reservation is done
Just OK
reviews.text: I cannot understand problems to find the hotel, Parking Place Kleber is less than 100 mtrs. away and signposted from every exit of the highway.

reviews.title: Good hotel in the middle of city
reviews.text: Situation is great: next to Galerie Lafayette, 5 minutes slow walk to Cathedral and 3 minutes to Petit France, so you can leave the car in the car park. Restaurants are next door.

reviews.title: Perfect location, nice hotel, but watch the gotchas
reviews.text: I started out not liking the hotel only because I drove around in the downtown Strasbourg area for 90 min lookin for it. Even with a navigational system, I had trouble with all of the 1 way streets. I ended up parking in a public lot and walking (not bad, and I saved € rather than parking at the hotel). It is a great area to walk in, but not to drive in. The hotel was just OK. The room was outdated to my tastes, especially the bathroom. I hate those 'dispensors for soap' on the wall that you use for shampoo and soap. But for one night I could not complain.

reviews.title: Wonderful location a very nice hotel
reviews.text: WE stayed two nights at this hotel. Very good location, Nice staffs, and spacious room.
